en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Nov. 6

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Saturday November 6, 1824 session, during which a man was summoned to court to face charges brought against him. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

none: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Nov. 6 : page 1

body.value: Saturday 6 Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors Jurors George Saunders Foreman Ordered by the Supreme Court that Richard Roe be summoned to appear at this place the second Monday in October next to answer to a complaint that Sarah Hughes and others has obtained from the National Committee. Court is adjourned untill until Monday 8th
